alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 12:13PM PDT until May 31 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Salmon Falls Creek Near Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. An active and wet weather pattern today and through the midweek may increase river levels and flows rapidly. For the Salmon Falls Creek...including Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY, MAY 31... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Salmon Falls Creek Near Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto. * WHEN...Until Wednesday, May 31. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs along the banks of Salmon Falls Creek. Water from Salmon Falls Creek begins entering the Salmon Falls Creek rest area along U.S. 93, about 3 miles south of Jackpot, NV. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM PDT Tuesday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 9.9 feet tomorrow afternoon. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 200 PM PDT.
